Comments_List: Great overview of the historiography and main themes/tensions in the literature

I learned a tremendous amount about the historiography of slavery and abolition in the Atlantic world. I also learned how to write comprehensively yet succinctly about a number of texts for both book reviews and historiography papers.
Strength--great balance between older/classic literature and brand new literature, not every class manages to cover both

I thought we covered incredibly important topics and I gained important training in how discuss texts in conversation and across time. I think it would have been useful to have more comprehensive question posts as opposed to comment posts.
Yes--great way to ground yourself in the literature of slavery and abolition.
Yes, it was very well structured and interdisciplinary in its approach
Yes - I think this course if vital for any students studying slavery, abolition, or the 19th century Atlantic world.
